title: Senior People Data Analyst
content:
Intercom is an AI powered, automation-first customer service platform that lets businesses deliver fast support, keeping customers satisfied, costs low, and service teams happy.
It is the only complete customer service solution that provides a seamless customer experience across automation and human support. Customer service teams from more than 25,000 global organizations, including Atlassian, Amazon and Microsoft, use Intercom to send over 600 million messages per month and enable interactions with over 800 million monthly active end users. The company was founded in 2011 and is backed by leading venture capitalist including Bessemer Venture Partners, Kleiner Perkins and Social Capital. We live by our six company values everyday: Success First, Customer Obsessed, Incredibly High Standards, Open Mindedness, Resilience, Impatience, and Positive & Optimistic. They are stitched into the way we work, interact with others, and hold ourselves accountable. We’re eager to hire individuals who are passionate about our mission, deeply aligned with our values, and are excited to help shape the future of customer service.What's the opportunity? 🤔
It’s an exciting time to join the People Org - we are building a new People Analytics Strategy, and we are committed to using data insights to continuously improve decisions, identify opportunities around employee experience, optimise engagement, and become deeply aligned with business priorities. 
In this position, you will partner with People teams and Business Leaders across Intercom to measure new initiatives and make data-driven recommendations around People programs and strategy. In addition to being experienced analytically, we’re looking for someone who can proactively surface recommendations and insights, who's comfortable prioritising work across multiple stakeholders, and who can work across our technology stack in order to solve problems. If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you!
What will I be doing? 🚀
You’ll be excited to build something new, joining up our various data flows to identify and build efficient methods to organise, store and analyse data
Connecting people data with business goals in order to drive business value
Presenting data in engaging ways, building charts, visualisations, dashboards and reports for senior leadership
You’ll need to be deeply analytical, with ownership over data quality and health
You’ll formulate techniques for quality data collection, and implement secure processes for data management
Partner with People teams at Intercom to help them better understand their functional areas, build understanding and use of our data, and set a high bar for leveraging analytics across the People organisation
Automate recurring tasks and explore potential investigation opportunities and data models via relevant programming language Python and/or R.
What skills do I need? 📖
We recognise that sometimes these lists can appear as strict requirements, but that’s not the case. Even if you feel you have a subset of the experience below - that’s ok, we’d love to talk to you!
Deep knowledge of data hygiene, including cleaning and automating data processes
Excellent SQL skills, fluency with BI/visualization tools, and deep knowledge of Excel, R, Python, or other analysis tools
Minimum of 2-3 years experience in quantitative role, preferably in People data and analytics
Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution etc.)
You’ll be a creative thinker about data, not afraid to innovate in order to create compelling narratives
You’ll have a strong understanding of how to measure engagement and insights
A proven track record of initiating and delivering actionable analyses/recommendations in order to drive business impact
Excellent communication skills, including experience in high-level business discussions
Leverage new tools, processes, and methodologies to interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques on an ad hoc and recurring basis.
Company Culture & Values:
At Intercom, we champion individuals who display a high degree of agency and autonomy. Our pace is fast, and our standards are  incredibly high. As a Senior People Data Analyst, you will be directly accountable for our data reporting and integrity, and we will rely on you to have impact and to actively drive our People Analytics strategy.
Growth & Career Opportunities:
This position offers more than a data role—it's a leadership journey. As a Senior Data Analyst, you will not only oversee Intercom’s People data, but also be put in a position to work with our leaders on driving business outcomes. At Intercom you’ll be in a position to rapidly accelerate your growth trajectory.
How will I be supported? 
You will buddy with another Dublin based colleague who will help you to onboard and get up to speed quickly
You will have a close group of peers to collaborate with and learn from
You will join a fun Dublin-based People team in a hybrid working environment.
Benefits 😍
We are a well-treated bunch, with awesome benefits! If there’s something important to you that’s not on this list, talk to us! :)
Competitive salary and equity in a fast-growing start-up
We serve lunch every weekday, plus a variety of snack foods and a fully stocked kitchen
Regular compensation reviews - we reward great work!
Peace of mind with life assurance, as well as comprehensive health and dental insurance for you and your dependents
Open vacation policy and flexible holidays so you can take time off when you need it
Paid maternity leave, as well as 6 weeks paternity leave for fathers, to let you spend valuable time with your loved ones
If you’re cycling, we’ve got you covered on the Cycle-to-Work Scheme. With secure bike storage too
MacBooks are our standard, but we’re happy to get you whatever equipment helps you get your job done.
#LI-HybridIntercom has a hybrid working policy. We believe that working in person helps us stay connected, collaborate easier and create a great culture while still providing flexibility to work from home. We expect employees to be in the office at least two days per week.
Intercom values diversity and is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity. Intercom will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law.
Is this role not quite what you're looking for? Join our Talent Community to stay connected with us.
